description:
Description
This should be a data set for a (partial?) replication of
Dee's (2004) article on the purported civics returns to education. I use
these data for in-class illustration about instrumental variable analyses.
title: Are There Civics Returns to Education?
reference: I should note I acquired this data set in Mexico City sitting on a two-week program at IPSA-FLACSO Mexico Summer School in 2019. The sample size here (9,227) is about two thousand short of what Dee reports in his article. It'll do, though.

parameters.hispanic: a numeric vector for if the person is Hispanic
parameters.black: a numeric vector for if the person is black
parameters.register: a numeric vector for if the person is registered to vote
parameters.distance: a numeric vector for the distance to college
parameters.college: a numeric vector for if the person went to college
parameters.schoolid: a numeric vector that should be understood as categorical
parameters.otherrace: a numeric vector for if the person is another race
parameters.female: a numeric vector for if the person is a woman

format: A data frame with 9227 observations on the following 8 variables.
